test_chunk:
Published as a workshop paper at ICLR 2024
LARGE LANGUAGE MODEL EVALUATION VIA MULTI
AI AGENTS: PRELIMINARY RESULTS
Zeeshan Rasheed, Muhammad Waseem, Kari Systä & Pekka Abrahamsson
Faculty of Information Technology and Communication Science, Tampere University
Faculty of Information Technology, Jyväskylä University
Tampere & Jyväskylä , Finland
{zeeshan.rasheed & pekka.abrahamsson}@tuni.fi
ABSTRACT
The increasing significance of Large Language Models (LLMs) in both the aca-
demic and industrial sectors can be attributed to their exceptional performance
across a diverse range of applications. As LLMs have become integral to both
research and daily operations, rigorous evaluation is crucial. This assessment is
important not only for individual tasks but also for understanding their societal
impact and potential risks. Despite extensive efforts to examine LLMs from var-
ious perspectives, there is a noticeable lack of multi-agent AI models specifically
designed to evaluate the performance

questions.question: What is a key reason for the rigorous evaluation of Large Language Models (LLMs)?
options: A) To ensure they are user-friendly
B) To understand their societal impact and risks
questions.explanation: The research emphasizes that evaluation is crucial for understanding the societal impact and potential risks of LLMs.

questions.question: What does the paper suggest about multi-agent AI models in evaluating LLMs?
options: B) There is a lack of them
questions.explanation: The paper highlights the noticeable lack of multi-agent AI models specifically designed for evaluating LLMs.
